discover.instruction: Read about connections between past actions and present situations. Notice how time shifts.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай о связи между прошлыми действиями и настоящими ситуациями. Обрати внимание на сдвиги во времени.

content.text:
<highlight>If I had studied</highlight> medicine, I <highlight>would be</highlight> a doctor now. (past action → present result)
<highlight>If she hadn't moved</highlight> to Paris, she <highlight>wouldn't know</highlight> French. (past action → present result)
<highlight>If I were</highlight> more organized, I <highlight>wouldn't have lost</highlight> my keys yesterday. (present trait → past result)
<highlight>If he weren't</highlight> so lazy, he <highlight>would have finished</highlight> the project on time. (present trait → past result)
<highlight>If we had taken</highlight> that job, we <highlight>would be living</highlight> in Tokyo now.
content.question: What's different about the times in these conditionals?
content.question_ru: Что необычного во временах в этих условных предложениях?

points.rule_ru: Тип 1: Условие в прошлом → Результат в настоящем
points.example: If I had studied law, I would be a lawyer now.

points.rule: Form Type 1: If + had + V3, would + infinitive
points.rule_ru: Форма Типа 1: If + had + V3, would + инфинитив
points.example: If he had married her, he would be happy now.

points.rule_ru: Тип 2: Условие в настоящем → Результат в прошлом
points.example: If she weren't so shy, she would have spoken up yesterday.

points.rule: Form Type 2: If + past simple, would have + V3
points.rule_ru: Форма Типа 2: If + past simple, would have + V3
points.example: If I were braver, I would have asked her out.

points.rule: Use: When past and present are linked logically
points.rule_ru: Использование: Когда прошлое и настоящее логически связаны
points.example: Past decisions affect present state; Present traits explain past actions

comparison_table.example: If I were rich, I would travel.
If I had won, I would have celebrated.
If I had won, I would be rich now.
If I were brave, I would have told her.

notice.instruction: Identify the time of condition and result in each sentence.
notice.instruction_ru: Определи время условия и результата в каждом предложении.

tasks.text:
Life is full of 'what ifs':

1. If I had learned to code as a child, I would be a software engineer now.
2. If she weren't so stubborn, she would have listened to the advice.
3. If they had invested in Bitcoin early, they would be millionaires today.
4. If I weren't afraid of heights, I would have tried bungee jumping.
5. If he had taken that job in 2015, he wouldn't be struggling financially now.
6. If she were more patient, she wouldn't have given up so quickly.
7. If I had been born in a different country, my life would be completely different.

notice.reflection_question: When do we use Mixed Type 1 vs Mixed Type 2?
notice.reflection_question_ru: Когда мы используем Смешанный Тип 1 vs Смешанный Тип 2?

sentences.sentence: If I ___ (study) harder at school, I ___ (have) a better job now.
If she ___ (be) more confident, she ___ (get) the promotion last year.
If they ___ (not/move) to London, they ___ (not/be) so successful today.
If he ___ (not/be) so forgetful, he ___ (not/miss) the appointment yesterday.
If I ___ (save) more money in my 20s, I ___ (own) a house now.
If she ___ (speak) better English, she ___ (understand) the instructions earlier.
If we ___ (buy) Bitcoin in 2010, we ___ (be) millionaires.
If I ___ (be) taller, I ___ (play) basketball in high school.

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct type of conditional for each situation.

questions.situation: He didn't study medicine, so he's not a doctor now.
She's not careful, so she made a mistake yesterday.
I didn't see the email yesterday, so I didn't reply.
questions.explanation: Both condition and result are in the past

sentences.incorrect: If I had studied medicine, I would have been a doctor now.
sentences.correct: If I had studied medicine, I would be a doctor now.
sentences.explanation: Present result = would be, not would have been

sentences.incorrect: If she was more careful, she wouldn't have made that mistake.
sentences.correct: If she were more careful, she wouldn't have made that mistake.
sentences.explanation: In formal English: were (not was) in conditionals

produce.instruction: Write about how past decisions affect your present, or how your character has influenced past events.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши о том, как прошлые решения влияют на настоящее, или как твой характер повлиял на прошлые события.
prompts: How would your life be different now if you had made different choices?
What would you have done differently if you had a different personality?
Write about regrets connecting past and present
produce.example: My life would be very different if I had made other choices. If I had studied abroad, I would probably be living in another country now. If I had learned programming when I was young, I would be earning more money today. On the other hand, my personality has also affected my past. If I weren't so shy, I would have made more friends at university. If I were more adventurous, I would have traveled more in my twenties. But I can't complain - if I had taken a different path, I wouldn't have the wonderful family I have now!
criteria: Uses Mixed Type 1 (past condition → present result)
Uses Mixed Type 2 (present condition → past result)

texts.title: Career Reflections
texts.content: Looking back at my career, I think about alternatives. If I had accepted that job in Singapore, I would be living in Asia now. If I weren't so risk-averse, I would have started my own business years ago. If I had learned Chinese in college, I would have more opportunities today. My colleague often says if she weren't so ambitious, she wouldn't have sacrificed so much for her career. If we had known how technology would change, we would all be in different jobs now.

texts.title: Relationship What-Ifs
texts.content: Sometimes I wonder about past relationships. If I had been more mature then, I would still be with her now. If I weren't so independent, I might have tried harder to make it work. She once said that if she hadn't moved away, we would be married today. If I were better at expressing my feelings, I wouldn't have lost her. But if we had stayed together, would I be the person I am now? Everything happens for a reason.

texts.title: Financial Decisions
texts.content: Financial experts always discuss what-ifs. If people had saved more in their 20s, they would be more secure now. If I weren't so impulsive, I would have saved more money by now. If investors had recognized the potential of tech stocks early, they would be wealthy today. If I were better with numbers, I wouldn't have made those poor investment decisions. They say if you had put $100 in Amazon in 1997, you would have over $100,000 now!

texts.title: Education Paths
texts.content: Education shapes our lives. If I had studied engineering, I would be working in a completely different field now. If I weren't so passionate about arts, I would have chosen a more practical major. My parents believe if they had encouraged me more, I would have become a doctor. If I were more disciplined, I would have studied harder and gotten better grades. But if I had followed their advice, I wouldn't be doing what I love today.

texts.title: Health Choices
texts.content: Health is about choices. If I had exercised regularly in my youth, I would be much fitter now. If I weren't so lazy, I would have developed better habits long ago. Doctors say if people had quit smoking earlier, many diseases wouldn't exist today. If I were more health-conscious, I wouldn't have eaten so much junk food in college. My grandfather always says if he had known about healthy eating, he would have lived differently.
